column4: how can I find out if a process is sending/receiving anything through the network?
tcpdump, strace, netstat
what do lines like "sigprocmask(SIG_BLOCK, NULL, [])        = 0" mean? (strace)
process masks
any way to show only in/out packages?
not really
does cat /proc/cpuinfo show 2 cpu's
only 1. And lshw shows one as disabled
sounds like it's not being used
here: http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/71112/
looks like it's not enabled
is that the default for ubuntu or this kernel version?
show me uname -a
Linux otto-desktop 2.6.24-21-generic #1 SMP Tue Oct 21 23:43:45 UTC 2008 i686 GNU/Linux
smp kernel - check your bios to see if ht is enabled
sorry, what is smp kernel? (smp isn't a command)
smp is "multi processor"
perhaps the motherboard can't support it?
check the bios to see if ht is enabled
ok
I didn't find any option related to ht
